page.title: 14PLANTS,ROADS & AIRFIELDS
page.content: All Plant Operators are taught how to maintain their machines. Should serious faults occur then these have to be repaired by trained fitters in the workshops. Courses are run by the PR&A to train soldiers as fitters. The PR&A courses practice building roads etc, at Lodge Hill. Before they actually carry out real construction work many hours are spent in the classroom using models. The Royal Engineers don't build airfields any more .They do however have a regiment with a responsibility for repairing airfields and they do build runways and pads for Harrier aircraft. All these skills are taught by The PR&A at Lodge Hill. In addition to teaching soldiers from the Infantry and Artillary part of the job of PR&A is to teach soldiers from the Royal Mechanical and Electrical
